qas.question: What is the abbreviation by which the University of Kansas is known?
Where is the main branch of the University of Kansas located?
What is the tallest point in Lawrence?
Who authorized the opening of the University of Kansas?
In what year was Kansas made a member of the United States?
What is the abbreviation by which the University of Kentucky is known?
Where is the side branch of the University of Kansas located?
What is the lowest point in Lawrence?
Who authorized the closing of the University of Kansas?
In what year was Kansas made a member of the United Nations?

context: The University of Kansas (<a0_0><b5_0>KU<b5_0/><a0_0/>) is a public research university and the largest in the U.S. state of Kansas. KU branch campuses are located in the towns of <a1_0>Lawrence<a1_0/>, Wichita, Overland Park, Salina, and Kansas City, Kansas, with the main campus located in <b6_0>Lawrence on <a2_0><b7_0>Mount Oread<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, the highest location in Lawrence. Founded March 21, 1865, the university was opened in 1866, under a charter granted by <a3_0>the <b8_0>Kansas State Legislature<b8_0/><a3_0/> in 1864 following enabling legislation passed in 1863 under the Kansas State Constitution, adopted two years after the <a4_0><b9_0>1861<b9_0/><a4_0/> admission of the former Kansas Territory as the 34th state into the Union following a very famous bloody internal civil war known as "Bleeding Kansas" during the 1850s.
